001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005import java.util.stream.DoubleStream;
006import java.util.stream.IntStream;
007
008import org.apache.commons.statistics.distribution.GammaDistribution;
009import org.immutables.value.Value;
010
011/**
012 * A delay distribution representing a probability distribution in discrete time
013 * conditional on an event happening. This class is useful for generating
014 * per-day conditional hazards and modelling time-to-event data.
015 *
016 * <p>
017 * <b>Input Constraints:</b>
018 * <ul>
019 * <li>The profile array must contain non-negative values</li>
020 * <li>The profile array should not contain NaN or infinite values</li>
021 * <li>pAffected must be in the range [0, 1]</li>
022 * <li>Empty profile arrays are supported but result in empty distributions</li>
023 * </ul>
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * <b>Key Mathematical Relationships:</b> \[ \text{density}_i =
027 * \text{condDensity}_i \times p_{\text{affected}} \\ \text{condDensity}_i =
028 * \frac{\text{profile}_i}{\sum_j \text{profile}_j} \\ S_i = 1 - \sum_{j=0}^i
029 * \text{density}_j \\ h_i = \frac{\text{density}_i}{S_{i-1}} \quad (i > 0) \\
030 * h_0 = \text{density}_0 \] where S denotes the survival function and h denotes
031 * the hazard function.
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * Relationships are discrete versions of:
035 * https://grodri.github.io/glms/notes/c7s1
036 *
037 * @see Serializable
038 * @see GammaDistribution
039 * @see ImmutableDelayDistribution
040 */
041@Value.Immutable
042public abstract class DelayDistribution implements Serializable {
043
044        /**
045         * Creates a discretised gamma distribution as a delay distribution.
046         * Automatically determines length based on mean + 2 standard deviations.
047         *
048         * @param mean mean of the gamma distribution
049         * @param sd   standard deviation of the gamma distribution
050         * @return discretised gamma delay distribution
051         */
052        public static DelayDistribution discretisedGamma(double mean, double sd) {
053                return discretisedGamma(mean, sd, (int) Math.round(mean + 2 * sd));
054        }
055
056        /**
057         * Creates a discretised gamma distribution with specified length. Gamma
058         * distribution is discretised by integrating over unit intervals.
059         *
060         * @param mean   mean of the gamma distribution
061         * @param sd     standard deviation of the gamma distribution
062         * @param length number of time points in the discretisation
063         * @return discretised gamma delay distribution
064         */
065        public static DelayDistribution discretisedGamma(
066                        double mean, double sd, int length
067        ) {
068                double shape = (mean * mean) / (sd * sd);
069                double scale = (sd * sd) / mean;
070                GammaDistribution tmp = GammaDistribution.of(shape, scale);
071                double[] out = new double[length];
072                double x0 = 0D;
073                double x1 = 0.5D;
074                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
075                        out[i] = tmp.probability(x0, x1);
076                        x0 = x1;
077                        x1 += 1;
078                }
079                return ImmutableDelayDistribution.builder().setProfile(out).build();
080        }
081
082        /**
083         * Creates an empty delay distribution with zero length.
084         *
085         * @return empty DelayDistribution instance
086         */
087        public static DelayDistribution empty() {
088                return ImmutableDelayDistribution.builder().setProfile(new double[0])
089                                .build();
090        }
091
092        /**
093         * Trims the tail of an array by removing elements until the cumulative sum
094         * reaches within epsilon of the total (either absolute or relative). Useful
095         * for reducing memory usage while preserving accuracy.
096         *
097         * @param x        array to trim
098         * @param epsilon  tolerance value
099         * @param absolute if true, epsilon is absolute; if false, epsilon is
100         *                 relative
101         * @return trimmed array
102         */
103        public static double[] trimTail(
104                        double[] x, double epsilon, boolean absolute
105        ) {
106                double total = 0;
107                for (double element : x) {
108                        total += element;
109                }
110                double limit = absolute ? total - epsilon : total * (1 - epsilon);
111                for (int i = x.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
112                        total -= x[i];
113                        if (total < limit) return Arrays.copyOf(x, i + 1);
114                }
115                return new double[0];
116        }
117
118        /**
119         * Removes trailing zeros from an array. Useful for cleaning up distributions
120         * where the tail has negligible probability.
121         *
122         * @param x array to trim
123         * @return array with trailing zeros removed
124         */
125        public static double[] trimZeros(double[] x) {
126                int i = x.length;
127                if (x[i - 1] > 0) return x;
128                while (i > 0) {
129                        if (x[i - 1] > 0) return Arrays.copyOf(x, i);
130                        i = i - 1;
131                }
132                return new double[0];
133        }
134
135        /**
136         * Creates a DelayDistribution from raw unnormalised profile values.
137         * Automatically trims trailing zeros and sets pAffected to 1.
138         *
139         * @param profile raw counts or unnormalised probabilities
140         * @return normalised DelayDistribution instance
141         */
142        public static ImmutableDelayDistribution unnormalised(double... profile) {
143                return ImmutableDelayDistribution.builder().setProfile(trimZeros(profile))
144                                .setPAffected(1).build();
145        }
146
147        /**
148         * Computes the proportion of individuals expected to be affected by day x.
149         * Equivalent to the cumulative distribution function at time x.
150         *
151         * @param intValue time index (day number)
152         * @return proportion affected by time x
153         */
154        public double affected(int intValue) {
155                return 1 - this.survival()[intValue];
156        }
157
158        /**
159         * Computes the conditional probability density function (PDF). Conditional
160         * on the event occurring, the sum equals 1.
161         *
162         * @return array of conditional probabilities
163         */
164        @Value.Derived
165        public double[] condDensity() {
166                if (this.getProfile().length == 0) return new double[0];
167                return DoubleStream.of(this.getProfile()).map(d -> d / this.total())
168                                .toArray();
169        }
170
171        /**
172         * Gets the conditional density value at the specified time index. Returns 0
173         * for indices outside the valid range.
174         *
175         * @param x time index (must be non-negative)
176         * @return conditional density value at time x, or 0 if out of bounds
177         */
178        public double condDensity(int x) {
179                if ((x < 0) || (x >= this.condDensity().length)) return 0;
180                return this.condDensity()[x];
181        }
182
183        /**
184         * Creates a new delay distribution with the specified ultimate affected
185         * probability. Useful for sensitivity analysis or modelling different
186         * scenarios.
187         *
188         * @param pAffected new ultimate affected probability in range [0, 1]
189         * @return new DelayDistribution instance with updated pAffected
190         */
191        public DelayDistribution conditionedOn(double pAffected) {
192                return ImmutableDelayDistribution.builder().from(this)
193                                .setPAffected(pAffected).build();
194        }
195
196        /**
197         * Computes the discrete convolution of two arrays. output[i] = ∑(input[i-j]
198         * × by[j]) for j < i and j < by.length
199         */
200        private double[] convolution(double[] input, double[] by) {
201                double[] output = new double[input.length];
202                for (int i = 0; i < input.length; i++) {
203                        for (int j = 0; j < i && j < by.length; j++) {
204                                output[i] += input[i - j] * by[j];
205                        }
206                }
207                return output;
208        }
209
210        /**
211         * Computes the convolution of an input array with the density array. Useful
212         * for modelling probability-weighted delayed effects.
213         *
214         * @param input array to convolve
215         * @return convolved result
216         */
217        public double[] convolveDensity(double[] input) {
218                return this.convolution(input, this.density());
219        }
220
221        /**
222         * Computes the convolution of an input array with the profile array. Useful
223         * for modelling delayed effects over time.
224         *
225         * @param input array to convolve
226         * @return convolved result
227         */
228        public double[] convolveProfile(double[] input) {
229                return this.convolution(input, this.getProfile());
230        }
231
232        /**
233         * Computes the cumulative distribution function (CDF) up to time x.
234         * Represents the probability of being affected by time x.
235         *
236         * @param x time index (must be non-negative)
237         * @return cumulative probability in range [0, 1]
238         */
239        public double cumulative(int x) {
240                if (x < 0) return 0;
241                if (x >= this.survival().length) return 1;
242                return 1 - this.survival()[x];
243        }
244
245        /**
246         * Computes the unconditional probability density function (PDF). The sum of
247         * densities equals pAffected (not 1, unless pAffected = 1).
248         *
249         * @return array of unconditional probabilities
250         */
251        @Value.Derived
252        public double[] density() {
253                if (this.getProfile().length == 0) return new double[0];
254                return DoubleStream.of(this.condDensity())
255                                .map(d -> d * this.getPAffected()).toArray();
256        }
257
258        /**
259         * Gets the unconditional density value at the specified time index. Returns
260         * 0 for indices outside the valid range.
261         *
262         * @param x time index (must be non-negative)
263         * @return density value at time x, or 0 if out of bounds
264         */
265        public double density(int x) {
266                if ((x < 0) || (x >= this.density().length)) return 0;
267                return this.density()[x];
268        }
269
270        /**
271         * Computes the expected number of events for sample size 1. Equivalent to
272         * the mean of the unconditional distribution.
273         *
274         * @return expected number of events
275         */
276        public double expected() {
277                return this.expected(1);
278        }
279
280        /**
281         * Computes the expected number of events for the given sample size.
282         *
283         * @param sampleSize number of individuals in the population
284         * @return expected number of events in the population
285         */
286        public double expected(double sampleSize) {
287                double out = 0.0D;
288                for (int i = 0; i < this.density().length; i++) {
289                        out += i * this.density()[i];
290                }
291                return out * sampleSize;
292        }
293
294        /**
295         * Returns the probability of being affected by time infinity (1 - survival
296         * at infinity). Defaults to 1.0 (all individuals will eventually be
297         * affected).
298         *
299         * @return probability in range [0, 1] representing ultimate affected
300         *         proportion
301         */
302        @Value.Default
303        public double getPAffected() { return 1.0; }
304
305        /**
306         * Returns the raw unnormalised counts or probabilities supporting the delay
307         * distribution. This array represents the raw observations or probability
308         * mass before normalisation.
309         *
310         * @return non-empty array of raw values (counts or unnormalised
311         *         probabilities)
312         */
313        abstract public double[] getProfile();
314
315        /**
316         * Finds the smallest time index where cumulative probability exceeds the
317         * given threshold. Equivalent to quantile function for the discrete
318         * distribution.
319         *
320         * @param d probability threshold in range [0, 1]
321         * @return smallest time index where cumulative > d
322         */
323        public int getQuantile(double d) {
324                for (int i = 0; i < this.size(); i++) {
325                        if (this.cumulative(i) > d) return i;
326                }
327                return (int) this.size();
328        }
329
330        /**
331         * Computes the unconditional hazard function. Conditional probability of
332         * being affected at time i given survival to time i-1.
333         *
334         * @return array of hazard rates
335         */
336        @Value.Derived
337        public double[] hazard() {
338                if (this.getProfile().length == 0) return new double[0];
339                double[] hazard = new double[this.survival().length];
340                for (int i = 0; i < this.density().length; i++) {
341                        hazard[i] = this.density()[i] / (i == 0 ? 1 : this.survival()[i - 1]);
342                }
343                return hazard;
344        }
345
346        /**
347         * Gets the hazard rate at the specified time index. Returns 0 for indices
348         * outside the valid range.
349         *
350         * @param x time index (must be non-negative)
351         * @return hazard rate at time x, or 0 if out of bounds
352         */
353        public double hazard(int x) {
354                if ((x < 0) || (x >= this.hazard().length)) return 0;
355                return this.hazard()[x];
356        }
357
358        /**
359         * Computes the mean of the conditional distribution. Represents the expected
360         * time until event occurrence among those affected.
361         *
362         * @return mean time to event (conditional on event occurrence)
363         */
364        public double mean() {
365                double[] density = this.condDensity();
366                return IntStream.range(0, density.length).mapToDouble(i -> i * density[i])
367                                .sum();
368        }
369
370        /**
371         * Gets the raw profile value at the specified time index. Returns 0 for
372         * indices outside the valid range.
373         *
374         * @param x time index (must be non-negative)
375         * @return profile value at time x, or 0 if out of bounds
376         */
377        public double profile(int x) {
378                if ((x < 0) || (x >= this.getProfile().length)) return 0;
379                return this.getProfile()[x];
380        }
381
382        /**
383         * Returns the length of the delay distribution (number of time points).
384         *
385         * @return number of time points in the distribution
386         */
387        public long size() {
388                return this.density().length;
389        }
390
391        /**
392         * Computes the unconditional survival function. Probability of surviving
393         * (not being affected) up to each time point.
394         *
395         * @return array of survival probabilities
396         */
397        @Value.Derived
398        public double[] survival() {
399                if (this.getProfile().length == 0) return new double[0];
400                double[] survival = new double[this.density().length];
401
402                for (int i = 0; i < this.density().length; i++) {
403                        survival[i] = (i == 0 ? 1 : survival[i - 1]) - this.density()[i];
404                }
405                return survival;
406        }
407
408        /**
409         * Returns a string representation showing the density array and pAffected.
410         *
411         * @return string representation of the distribution
412         */
413        @Override
414        public String toString() {
415                return "P(" + Arrays.toString(this.density()) + "|" + this.getPAffected()
416                                + ")";
417        }
418
419        /**
420         * Computes the sum of all values in the profile array. Used as a normalising
421         * constant for converting to conditional probability.
422         *
423         * @return sum of all profile values
424         */
425        @Value.Derived
426        public double total() {
427                return DoubleStream.of(this.getProfile()).sum();
428        }
429}
